III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The following technical assistance was provided:
The Environmental Inspection resulted in an A rating, however noted the back-
flow prevention device to the fire suppression tank was not inspected in the past
year. This needs to be inspected and supplied to Health Department with proof
of inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
There was no consultation requested or required.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There was one confirmed incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. This was within investigation report 2024C0001099 dated 02/21/2024
which found the facility in non-compliance of a staff member grabbing and pulling a
youth to the floor. A correction action plan dated 2/29/2024 was approved that
included the staff member involved being terminated from employment.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted four acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: 2023
Renewal: Corrective Action plan was recorded during this reporting period as a
result of the Interim inspection completed on July 26, 2023. This CAP contained
one violation for the facility constructing two walls prior to submitting plans for the
construction. The facility reviewed the rule with staff. The facility is currently
complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP
compliance with no noted concerns.
Special investigation 2024C0000978 with CAP approval date of 01/05/2024 was a
result of an unwarranted restraint and late incident report. The facility had a team
meeting to discuss when it is appropriate to restrain youth and completed a
refresher training during Academy for restraints and incident reports. The facility is
currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor
CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Special investigation 2024C0001253 with a CAP approval date of 06/28/2024 was
a result of an unwarranted restraint and late incident report. A new process was
implemented to track and monitor restraint entries to ensure incident reports are
being entered timely. Supervision and refresher restraint training occurred with
staff involved in the restraint. The facility is currently complying with the CAP
action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with no noted
concerns.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
since the last reporting period the facility has found different techniques to work
with younger youth which seem to be helping the group dynamics. Staff are
developing individual plans with the youth to do schoolwork, participate in an
activity and then return to schoolwork. The plans are helping the youth be more
successful in school. The agency as a whole continues to work on hiring more
staff and becoming more consistent in the facility.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported there have been some youth with difficult behaviors recently at the
facility but feeling like the agency provides the tools necessary to work with those
youth. One staff reported staff are very hands on with youth and try to engage in a
lot of different activities to keep the youth in the facility busy. Staff reported regular
training, strong leadership and feeling supported by administration.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported having
many fun activities such as swimming, bike riding and painting. Youth described
having regular therapy appointments, getting along with staff and feeling safe at
the facility. None of the youth interviewed reported having any concerns with staff
or the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on July 2, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
